revision.text:
[[File:Justin Timberlake Cannes 2013.jpg|thumbnail|right|Timberlake at the [[2013 Cannes Film Festival|Cannes Film Festival]], May 2013]] American entertainer [[Justin Timberlake]] has released four [[video album]]s and has been featured in thirty-seven [[music video]]s, seventeen films, fifteen television shows, and six commercials. He achieved early fame when he appeared in the [[Disney Channel]] television series ''[[The All-New Mickey Mouse Club]]'', alongside singers [[Britney Spears]] and [[Christina Aguilera]] and actor [[Ryan Gosling]].{{cite web|last=Henderson|first=Alex|accessdate=December 7, 2012|url=https://allmusic.com/cg/amg.dll?p=amg&sql=11:jbftxqwjld6e~T1|title=Justin Timberlake – Biography|publisher=[[AllMusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101003032225/http://www.allmusic.com/cg/amg.dll?p=amg|archive-date=2010-10-03|url-status=dead}} Timberlake rose to fame in the late 1990s as the lead singer of the boy band [[NSYNC]].{{cite web|accessdate=December 7, 2012|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/Story?id=4143898&page=3|title=Ex-Mouseketeers: Where Are They Now?|publisher=[[ABC News]]. [[The Walt Disney Company]] }} In 2002, he launched his solo career and released his solo debut single "[[Like I Love You]]", the music video for which was directed by [[Diane Martel|Bucky Chrome]]. [[Francis Lawrence]] directed the video for "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]". The video features Timberlake's character as he spies on a former lover, who according to the director portrays his former romantic interest Spears.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DksSPZTZES0|title=Justin Timberlake — Cry Me a River|publisher=[[Vevo]]. [[YouTube]]|accessdate=December 7, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1476973/river-about-britney-justin-but-not.jhtml |title='Cry Me A River' About Britney And Justin, But Not: VMA Lens Recap |date=August 18, 2003 |accessdate=December 23, 2011 |publisher=[[MTV News]]. [[Viacom (2005–present)|Viacom]] |last=Moss |first=Corey |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131031144756/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1476973/river-about-britney-justin-but-not.jhtml |archivedate=October 31, 2013 }} At the [[2003 MTV Video Music Awards]], the video won the accolades for [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Male Video|Best Male Video]] and [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Pop Video|Best Pop Video]].{{cite journal|year=2003|title=Top VMA Award Winners|journal=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |page=68 |publisher=[[Nielsen Business Media]], Inc|doi= |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bg8EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA68&dq=%22Cry+Me+a+River%22+Justin+Timberlake#v=onepage&q=%22Cry%20Me%20a%20River%22%20Justin%20Timberlake&f=false|accessdate=May 18, 2012|issn=0006-2510|volume=115}} In 2005, Timberlake starred in the thriller ''[[Edison (film)|Edison]]'' alongside [[Morgan Freeman]] and [[Kevin Spacey]]. The film received negative reviews from film critics and was a [[box office bomb]].{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/edison_force/|title=Edison (Edison Force)|publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]. [[Flixster]]|accessdate=December 8, 2012}} He then portrayed Frankie Ballenbacher in the crime drama ''[[Alpha Dog]]'' (2006); it received mixed responses from critics and attained box office success.{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/alpha_dog/|title=Alpha Dog|publisher=Rotten Tomatoes. Flixster|accessdate=December 8, 2012}} The same year, Timberlake released his second studio album ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]''—four music videos for singles from the album were shot. [[Samuel Bayer]] directed the music video for "[[What Goes Around... Comes Around]]" (2007) in which American actress [[Scarlett Johansson]] plays Timberlake's love interest.{{cite web|last=Vineyard |first=Jennifer |title=Justin Timberlake Went 'Around' And Came Out With A Broken Finger: VMA Lens Recap |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1568745/20070831/timberlake_justin.jhtml |publisher=MTV News. Viacom|date=September 4, 2007 |accessdate=December 8, 2012}} From 2007 until 2009, he appeared in the music videos for his collaborations with other artists including [[50 Cent]] ("[[Ayo Technology]]"), [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] ("[[4 Minutes (Madonna song)|4 Minutes]]") and [[T.I.]] ("[[Dead and Gone]]"). Timberlake starred in the 2010 drama ''[[The Social Network]]'', in which he portrayed [[Sean Parker]], the first president of [[Facebook]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/blogs/press-here/124786449.html|title=Justin Timberlake to Play Sean Parker in Real Life|publisher=[[NBC Bay Area]]. [[NBC]]|last=Farooq|first=Sajid|date=June 30, 2011|accessdate=December 8, 2012}} The film received acclaim from critics and was a box office success.{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the-social-network/|title=The Social Network|publisher=Rotten Tomatoes. Flixster|accessdate=December 12, 2012}} In 2011, he starred in the comedies ''[[Bad Teacher]]'' and ''[[Friends with Benefits (film)|Friends with Benefits]]'' alongside [[Cameron Diaz]] and [[Mila Kunis]] respectively. Both films were financial successes. The music videos for his songs "[[Mirrors (Justin Timberlake song)|Mirrors]]" and "[[Suit & Tie]]" were released in 2013. They earned him a [[MTV Video Music Award for Video of the Year]]{{cite web|title=Justin Timberlake, Macklemore and Ryan Lewis Lead MTV VMA Nominations |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/justin-timberlake-macklemore-and-ryan-lewis-lead-mtv-vma-nominations-20130717|website=rollingstone.com|accessdate=July 31, 2014|date=2013-07-17}} and a [[Grammy Award for Best Music Video]],{{Cite web|url = http://theboombox.com/justin-timberlake-wins-2014-grammy-award-best-music-video/|title = Justin Timberlake Takes Home 2014 Grammy Award for Best Music Video|date = January 26, 2014|accessdate = July 28, 2014|website = The Boom Box|last = Josephs|first = Brian}} respectively. Timberlake has also hosted ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' [[List of Saturday Night Live guests#Five-Timers Club|five times]], being both host and musical guest three times. In film, he released ''[[Justin Timberlake + The Tennessee Kids]]'' and voiced Branch in ''[[Trolls (film)|Trolls]]'' (2016) as well as its sequel ''[[Trolls World Tour]]'' (2020). == Music videos == [[File:Joseph kahn 01 (cropped).jpg|150px|thumbnail|right|alt= A picture of an Asian man who wears glasses and smilles.|The music videos for "[[Work It (Nelly song)|Work It]]" and "[[Ayo Technology]]" were directed by [[Joseph Kahn]].]] [[File:Akiva Schaffer - Premiere of Hot Rod.jpg|thumb|150px|alt=A profile picture of a blonde man who is smilling. He wears glasses and tuxedo.|[[Akiva Schaffer]] directed the music videos for "[[Dick in a Box]]", "[[Jizz in My Pants]]", "[[Motherlover]]", and "[[3-Way (The Golden Rule)]]".]] [[File:David Fincher (2012) 3.jpg|150px|thumbnail|right|[[David Fincher]] directed the music video for Timberlake's 2013 single "[[Suit & Tie]]".]] === As a performer === {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align: center;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:20em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:10em;"| Other performer(s) ! scope="col" style="width:10em;"| Director(s) ! scope="col" style="width:14em;"| Album ! scope="col" style="width:2em;"| Year ! scope="col" style="width:2em;" class="unsortable" | {{Abbr|Ref.|Reference}} |- ! scope="row" | "[[Like I Love You]]" | [[Clipse]] | {{sortname|Bucky|Chrome|Diane Martel}} | ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' | 2002 | {{cite web|title=Justin Timberlake "Like I Love You" |url=http://vimeo.com/50574518| publisher=[[Vimeo]] | accessdate=February 12, 2013}} |- ! scope="row" | "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]" | {{n/a}} | {{sortname|Francis|Lawrence}} | ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' | 2002 | {{cite web|title=Cry Me A River {{!}} Justin Timberlake {{!}} Music Video |url=http://www.mtv.com/videos/justin-timberlake/21256/cry-me-a-river.jhtml| publisher=MTV.
